items.title: Reclaiming Label of a Progressive City
items.abstract: A look at three books: a collection of essays arguing for progressive policies in New York City; the history of the pizza box; and a tour through old hangouts and restaurants in the city.

items.title: Recalling Killing That Led Officers to Reclaim the City
items.abstract: More than a hundred officers gathered for the anniversary of the killing of Officer Edward Byrne, the 22-year-old rookie shot and killed in his car one morning in 1988.

items.title: With Vacation Rentals Empty, European Cities See a Chance to Reclaim Housing
items.abstract: Platforms like Airbnb have been criticized for raising living costs in popular cities. Now, officials are trying to move properties aimed at tourists to long-term leases.

items.title: Return to Mogadishu: Trying to Reclaim a City for Its People
items.abstract: A Somali expatriate makes an attempt to restore part of his homeland in Andrew Harding’s “The Mayor of Mogadishu.”
keywords: The Mayor of Mogadishu: A Story of Chaos and Redemption in the Ruins of Somalia (Book)

items.title: N.Y.C. Begins Reopening: Here’s What It Looks Like
items.abstract: After months of a devastating outbreak, the city is officially back in business, with as many as 400,000 people returning to work.
